chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.
items.plainText: Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.

items.text: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.
items.plainText: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.

items.text: He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.
items.plainText: He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.

items.text: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.
items.plainText: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.

items.text: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.
items.plainText: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.

items.text: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.
items.plainText: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.

items.text: There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture's eye hath not seen:
items.plainText: There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture's eye hath not seen:

items.text: The lion's whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.
items.plainText: The lion's whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.

items.text: He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.
items.plainText: He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.

items.text: He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.
items.plainText: He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.

items.text: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
items.plainText: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.

items.text: But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?
items.plainText: But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?

items.text: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.
items.plainText: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.

items.text: The depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.
items.plainText: The depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.

items.text: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.
items.plainText: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.

items.text: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.
items.plainText: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.

items.text: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.
items.plainText: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.

items.text: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.
items.plainText: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.

items.text: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
items.plainText: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

items.text: Whence then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?
items.plainText: Whence then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?

items.text: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.
items.plainText: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.

items.text: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.
items.plainText: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.

items.text: God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.
items.plainText: God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.

items.text: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;
items.plainText: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;

items.text: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.
items.plainText: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.

items.text: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:
items.plainText: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:

items.text: Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.
items.plainText: Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.

items.text: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
items.plainText: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
